27. bxc4?? (the error that costs the game - I think that I forgot that my knight was defending d2 so I took with the b pawn - if I had taken a deep breath and counted to ten before taking with the pawn I would have taken in the bigger picture and got rid of the backward pawn in one fell swoop)  Now on move 39 I pay, pay pay!

51.  I decide to take some satisfaction of winning back a pawn  before tossing in the sponge next move on the grounds of impending ruinous loss of material).  Well folks, this is my longest game against an Expert so far.  It just goes to show - one mistake against these Experts and it is CERTAIN that you will pay through the nose and end up with the BLOB!!
